org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io

Class DelimitedOutputFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.FileOutputFormat<Record>
      • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.FileOutputFormat
        • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.DelimitedOutputFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, InitializeOnMaster, OutputFormat<Record>

    public abstract class DelimitedOutputFormat
extends FileOutputFormat
    The base class for output formats that serialize their records into a delimited sequence.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • open

        public void open(int taskNumber,
                 int numTasks)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OutputFormat
        Opens a parallel instance of the output format to store the result of its parallel instance.

        When this method is called, the output format it guaranteed to be configured.

        Specified by:
        open in interface OutputFormat<Record>
        Overrides:
        open in class FileOutputFormat<Record>
        Parameters:
        taskNumber - The number of the parallel instance.
        numTasks - The number of parallel tasks.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the output could not be opened due to an I/O problem.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OutputFormat
        Method that marks the end of the life-cycle of parallel output instance. Should be used to close channels and streams and release resources. After this method returns without an error, the output is assumed to be correct.

        When this method is called, the output format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Specified by:
        close in interface OutputFormat<Record>
        Overrides:
        close in class FileOutputFormat<Record>
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the input could not be closed properly.

      • serializeRecord

        public abstract int serializeRecord(Record rec,
                                    byte[] target)
                             throws Exception
        This method is called for every record so serialize itself into the given target array. The method should return the number of bytes occupied in the target array. If the target array is not large enough, a negative value should be returned.

        The absolute value of the returned integer can be given as a hint how large an array is required. The array is resized to the return value's absolute value, if that is larger than the current array size. Otherwise, the array size is simply doubled.

        Parameters:
        rec - The record to be serialized.
        target - The array to serialize the record into.
        Returns:
        The length of the serialized contents, or a negative value, indicating that the array is too small.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the user code produces an exception that prevents processing the record, it should throw it such that the engine recognizes the situation as a fault.

      • writeRecord

        public void writeRecord(Record record)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: OutputFormat
        Adds a record to the output.

        When this method is called, the output format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Parameters:
        record - The records to add to the output.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the records could not be added to to an I/O problem.

      • configureDelimitedFormat

        public static DelimitedOutputFormat.ConfigBuilder configureDelimitedFormat(FileDataSink target)
        Creates a configuration builder that can be used to set the input format's parameters to the config in a fluent fashion.
        Returns:
        A config builder for setting parameters.
